intro: Psychotria dudleyi, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which make it significant in both botanical and pharmacological studies. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is also of interest in ecological and conservation research.
